desc:
Achievement icon URL, usually taken from WoW databes like wowhead (recomended) using the format //wow.zamimg.com/images/wow/icons/large/ability_warrior_innerrage.jpg
You can always set custom icons, but remember, for better perfomance use 56x56 images sizes, and serve them locally.
A better practice would be to place your icons on /wa-media/ folder and simply call it just like {"icon": "your_icon.jpg"}
If you specify an URL, then the achievement will become clickable.
There are two kind of achievements: character and guild based. Maybe in the future you can add your own achievement template.

IMPORTANT! This plugin uses its own media files (image and audio), said files are placed in the /wa-media/ folder, which have to be placed relatively to your index.html file. If that's the case, then you don't need to change this option. But if you need to use a custom path, or you have problems setting up this plugin (like images don't showing up) then you may specify /wa-media/ folder path here.
Set to true if you want to play a sound at the same time the achievement appears. Won't work on Internet Explorer 6 and other browsers who don't support HTML5 <audio> elements.
Language string, useful for translating this text (be careful with the length).
Shows the guild name on the achievement display. Becomes mandatory if you are displaying guild achievements (see type option).
Language string, useful for translating this text (be careful with the length).
Set for how long you want the achievement to be displayed until it starts to fade out (and eventually disappear).
